question: Find the name of the user who tweeted more than once, and number of tweets tweeted by them.
sql_query: SELECT T1.name ,  count(*) FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN tweets AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.uid GROUP BY T2.uid HAVING count(*)  >  1

question: Find the average number of followers for the users who had some tweets.
sql_query: SELECT avg(followers) FROM user_profiles WHERE UID IN (SELECT UID FROM tweets)

question: Find the number of followers for each user.
sql_query: SELECT count(*) FROM follows GROUP BY f1

question: Find the name and partition id for users who tweeted less than twice.
sql_query: SELECT T1.name ,  T1.partitionid FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN tweets AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.uid GROUP BY T2.uid HAVING count(*)  <  2

question: Find the number of users who posted some tweets.
Find the names of the users whose number of followers is greater than that of the user named "Tyler Swift".
sql_query: SELECT T1.name FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN follows AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.f1 GROUP BY T2.f1 HAVING count(*)  >  (SELECT count(*) FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN follows AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.f1 WHERE T1.name  =  'Tyler Swift')

question: List the text of all tweets in the order of date.
sql_query: SELECT text FROM tweets ORDER BY createdate

question: Return the text of tweets about the topic 'intern'.
sql_query: SELECT text FROM tweets WHERE text LIKE '%intern%'

question: Find the maximum and total number of followers of all users.
Find the id of users who are followed by Mary or Susan.
sql_query: SELECT T2.f1 FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN follows AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.f2 WHERE T1.name  =  "Mary" OR T1.name  =  "Susan"

question: Find the name of the user who has the largest number of followers.
sql_query: SELECT name FROM user_profiles ORDER BY followers DESC LIMIT 1

question: Find the names of users whose emails contain ‘superstar’ or ‘edu’.
sql_query: SELECT name FROM user_profiles WHERE email LIKE '%superstar%' OR email LIKE '%edu%'

question: What is the partition id of the user named "Iron Man".
sql_query: SELECT partitionid FROM user_profiles WHERE name  =  'Iron Man'

question: Find the names of users who have more than one tweet.
sql_query: SELECT T1.name FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN tweets AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.uid GROUP BY T2.uid HAVING count(*)  >  1

question: Find the average number of followers for the users who do not have any tweet.
sql_query: SELECT avg(followers) FROM user_profiles WHERE UID NOT IN (SELECT UID FROM tweets)

question: Find the name and email for the users who have more than one follower.
sql_query: SELECT T1.name ,  T1.email FROM user_profiles AS T1 JOIN follows AS T2 ON T1.uid  =  T2.f1 GROUP BY T2.f1 HAVING count(*)  >  1
